title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, families and the education system are mobilized and trained to guarantee the access, learning and permanence of girls and boys (especially indigenous) form 0 to 6 years of age living in most excluded rural and urban areas., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2019 children 0-5 years old, especially the 1.6 million living in extreme poverty, have their rights to survival, development, protection and participation guaranteed through comprehensive early child development policies, and children 6-11 years old have equitable access to quality primary school, with special attention to indigenous girls and boys.

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, families and the education system are mobilized and trained to guarantee the access, learning and permanenceof girls and boys (especially indigenous) form 0 to 6 years of age living in most excluded rural and urban areas.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mexico was successful in promoting inclusive education through promotion of indigenous education from the early years up to primary school, with special consideration of indigenous children living in urban areas. In 2019, UNICEF Mexico broadened its inclusive approach by developing strategies for migrant children and adolescents to access basic education in the country. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/01/2020
